headline.main: THE SUGAR INDSUTRY TURNS UP ITS SALES PITCH

docs.lead_paragraph: In the midst of an embarrassing flip-flop on its ''new'' and ''Classic'' formulas last summer, the Coca-Cola Company was attacked on another public relations front. ''Why did the 'Old Coca-Cola Drinkers of America' turn up their noses at Classic Coke?'' the American sugar industry asked in full-page newspaper advertisements. The answer, the ad said, was that the company began substituting corn syrup for sugar in Coke five years ago and failed to note the switch on its cans. Coca-Cola in turn accused the sugar makers of trying to ''deceive'' the public.
